description: This course is a service/learning experience.  Week one is spent on campus learning basic
clinical techniques, examining emerging disease, and studying existing health care
issues. Students spend three weeks in Cuzco, Peru, assessing patient needs in a public
hospital, a homeless shelter, orphanages, and a small village. Week four involves
discussion and writing reflective journals. Apply through the Office of International and
Off-Campus Studies. Offered during Interim. Prerequisites: BIO 150 or BIO 231,
